p: This page explains how to setup an OpenPEPPOL AS2 AccessPoint from scratch. AP is the abbreviation for Access Point which is the technical endpoint for sending and receiving business documents.
Before you can start you need to have the following information in place:

ol.li: As the very first step you need to sign the TIAs (Transport Infrastructure Agreements) with OpenPEPPOL AISBL
Afterwards you need to apply for an AP certificate at OpenPEPPOL. This certificate is required to run the AP.
At least one of the default PEPPOL BIS v2 (processes) must be implemented (according to the TIAs). A list of all available BISs is available on the PEPPOL website.
You should have a look at the official PEPPOL AS2 specifications.
You should be familiar with Java 1.6+
